text: hi everyone please then evoke tano here
the internet's busiest music
nerd and it's time for a review of the
new deftones album homes
this is the newest full-length lp from
legendary sacramento
alt metal outfit deftones ohms makes for
their ninth full-length lp
and it comes four years after the
painfully forgettable gore
in 2016. however the more i listen to
some parts of this new record i kind of
wish i could go
go back which is more than disappointing
because it's not like i went into this
record with the
highest expectations in the world
personally i have been
mostly agnostic toward everything the
band has put out in the 2010s
despite koino yokan being a major fan
favorite at this point
look i just prefer the menacing riffs
and songwriting of around the fur
or the savage bliss of white pony then
there's also the experimental and
controversial saturday night wrist which
is one of the most
texturally exciting records the band has
done thus far
for me it was somewhat of a shock to go
from that to the very heavy and bland
diamond eyes just a few years later and
i know that's more of a fantano opinion
than a deftones fan opinion because that
is pretty much a beloved album in the
band's canon
though again i'm not sure why that album
for me is so sonically
basic there's so little in the way of
nuance laced into its artificially
pumped up drums and guitars
part of what made deftone such an
exciting metal band in the 90s and 2000s
is that they were
more nuanced and dynamic than many of
their contemporaries
and while ohms does certainly have a
subtler presentation
to me this was another weak batch of
songs and there are some head-scratching
sounds
all over this record too the opener
genesis features this loud but totally
unimpressive two-note riffing
which is wrapped in these faux eerie
sci-fi
synthesizers that sound like they're
straight out of the soundtrack to a
terrible 80s movie
now pay attention to these synths
because this is not the only point on
the record
where they appear for some reason the
band seems to recycle them
over and over and over like there's some
bad sonic gimmick that's
going out of style vocally chino's just
screaming his brains out in
this mix with a very abrasive chorus
effect
on his voice too uh delivering lyrics
about rejecting
both sides of what you're being told
and like achieving balance as a result
of that i know deftone's lyrics tend to
run a little esoteric or
cryptic but what is being delivered here
is it some true centrist wet dream
where the socially agnostic rise up
through the ashes of our partisan
society once it burns down completely to
parade their unwillingness to engage
with complex issues
but honestly whatever is happening with
the lyrics here
it doesn't bother me nearly as much as
these grading guitars
grading vocals and these horrendous
indulgent synth experiments that get
less and less complementary to the
instrumental
as it drags on by comparison ceremony is
slightly more tuneful even if
the vocal harmonies on the hooks sound
slightly out of tune
there is a better song structure on this
track a better mix but
i can't shake the feeling that this is
what you would get if you held billy
corrigan at gunpoint
and forced him to write a really
mediocre deftone song with a glistening
atmosphere ringing guitars and a
brooding bass line
eurantia on the surface sounds a lot
more like it but if you took the billy
corrigan gun and you pointed it at me
i probably couldn't sing you a single
bar from this track
the vocal melodies on this one are just
that typical for deftones
not to mention the final leg of this
track is so tedious it's like being
stuck behind a school bus
in rush hour traffic then we have error
which i guess lives up to its title
because the drums sound terrible and
there are these hot
sour shots of guitar that like spray
into my ears as if they're
acid it's like the sonic equivalent of
taking an extension cord sawing through
it plugging it in and sucking on the
exposed wiring
somehow the incorporation of chunkier
riffs and a psychedelic bridge don't
make the song any more appealing
plus let me remind you that we're four
tracks into this record so far and chino
is yet to come up with one
single infectious vocal line mix-wise
there is more room to breathe on the
spell of mathematics but the stench is
so bad i'm trying not to inhale
chino's listless moaning on this track
comes off as totally
directionless even when he's digging
into his upper register and getting
super angsty
the instrumental consists of these very
ghostly ill-defined layers of droning
guitars vocal harmonies and more sci-fi
synths
it's like eating lasagna but the feeling
is melted halloween candy
then things switch up for the better on
the following track where we actually
have a tuneful vocal and some sensible
lyrics
there's a tastefully dynamic shift from
the skeletal very moody
subdued verses to the crushing riffs on
the hook too
sure the track sounds like it could be a
little bit like around the fur b
side or something but at this point i
will take it link is dead miraculously
is also one of the most coherent and
grooving songs on the record
it's like as soon as we transition into
the second half of the record
chino really starts to get his
together vocally the band is sounding a
lot tighter
the songs are actually memorable it's
not the most amazingly produced deftone
song ever but
i think the band uses the rawness of the
mix and
kind of the distortion of it as well to
their advantage to just sound really
aggressive like on their
early radiant city i guess is an
improvement on the first half as well
even if i think some of those speedy
guitar riffs are a little awkward
those droning synthesizers quietly
wailing away in the background they're
still there
still popping up adding nothing to the
record though but the band
insists on shoving them down our throats
meanwhile the track headless tries to
play things sinister but mostly comes
off safe
just because of how typical and
predictable the song is for death tones
however again i can't complain too much
given just how aggravating the first
half
of the lp was especially since the final
leg of the song is genuinely serene and
blissful
then there's the title track that i
mentioned earlier that is also the
closer of the record i loved it as a
single
and i still love it on the album i guess
it's my favorite track
it's just unfortunate that my favorite
song comes
at the very end and i enjoy it so much
more
than everything else on the record plus
even though it's my favorite track i
mean the band's approach here seems
pretty obvious songwriting-wise there's
not a whole lot here in terms of
evolution or surprise you could say it's
a typical deftone's number but then the
guitars
have this speedy sludge metal quality to
them that's maybe slightly progressive
it's like they got some dude from
baroness to come in
and just lay down some guitar lines for
it uh
look i did not enjoy this record i
didn't and i am pretty split
on the track list like there are a lot
of great moments that turn up on
the second half of this thing but god
the first five tracks are a punishment
yeah i'm feeling a strong three to a
light for
on this one tran position have you given
this album a listen did you love it did
you hate it
what would you rate it you're the best
you're the best what should i review
next
